metadata.title: Pro Plastics Inc. | Precision Plastic Manufacturing Since 1968
metadata.description: Custom plastic manufacturing in Linden, NJ, USA. CNC machining, fabrication & material distribution for aerospace, medical & semiconductor industries since 1968.

hero.subtitle: Precision Plastic Manufacturing
hero.description: Your complete source for custom plastic parts—from prototype to production. Expert CNC machining, fabrication, and material distribution for demanding industries.

testimonials.title: What Our Clients Say
testimonials.subtitle: Don't just take our word for it—hear from the companies that trust us with their precision plastic needs.

testimonial1.quote: Pro Plastics has been our go-to supplier for precision components for over a decade. Their quality and turnaround time are unmatched.

testimonial2.quote: The material expertise at Pro Plastics helped us select the perfect FDA-compliant plastic for our medical device application.
testimonial2.author: Product Development Manager

testimonial3.quote: From prototype to production, Pro Plastics delivered exactly what we needed. Highly recommend for semiconductor applications.

expertHelp.title: Need Help Selecting a Material?
expertHelp.subtitle: Our engineers can help you choose the optimal material for your specific application requirements.

peek.name: PEEK (Polyether Ether Ketone)
peek.description: Premium high-performance thermoplastic with excellent mechanical properties at elevated temperatures.

ultem.name: Ultem (PEI)
ultem.description: Polyetherimide with high strength, stiffness, and broad chemical resistance.

delrin.name: Delrin (Acetal)
delrin.description: High-strength acetal homopolymer with excellent dimensional stability and machinability.

nylon.name: Nylon 6/6
nylon.description: Versatile engineering plastic with excellent wear resistance and mechanical properties.

teflon.name: PTFE (Teflon)
teflon.description: Exceptional chemical resistance and lowest coefficient of friction of any solid material.

uhmw.name: UHMW Polyethylene
uhmw.description: Ultra high molecular weight PE with outstanding abrasion resistance and impact strength.

polycarbonate.name: Polycarbonate
polycarbonate.description: Virtually unbreakable with excellent optical clarity and impact resistance.

acrylic.name: Acrylic (PMMA)
acrylic.description: Crystal clear thermoplastic with excellent optical properties and weather resistance.

phenolic.name: Phenolic (Canvas/Linen)
phenolic.description: Fabric-reinforced laminate with excellent electrical and mechanical properties.

g10.name: G-10/FR-4 (Glass Epoxy)
g10.description: Glass fabric reinforced epoxy with superior electrical and mechanical properties.

pvc.name: PVC (Type I & II)
pvc.description: Cost-effective material with good chemical resistance and flame retardancy.

hdpe.name: HDPE
hdpe.description: High-density polyethylene with excellent chemical resistance and low moisture absorption.

about.title: About Pro Plastics Inc.
about.subtitle: For over 55 years, we've been a trusted partner for plastic parts manufacturing and fabrication, serving diverse industries worldwide with precision, quality, and dedication.

story.title: Our Story
story.paragraph1: Founded in 1968, Pro Plastics Inc. began as a small plastic fabrication shop in Linden, New Jersey. What started as a local operation has grown into a trusted manufacturing partner serving companies across the globe.
story.paragraph2: Our founder believed that precision manufacturing should be accessible to companies of all sizes. That philosophy continues today—whether you need a single prototype or thousands of production parts, we deliver the same exceptional quality and attention to detail.
story.paragraph3: Over five decades, we've invested in the latest CNC technology, expanded our material expertise, and built a team of skilled craftspeople who take pride in every part we produce. Today, we're proud to serve 12 distinct industries, from aerospace to medical devices.

timeline.title: Our Journey
timeline.subtitle: 55+ years of continuous growth, innovation, and commitment to excellence.

1968.title: Company Founded
1968.description: Pro Plastics Inc. established in Linden, New Jersey, starting with basic plastic fabrication services.

1980s.title: Expansion & Growth
1980s.description: Expanded capabilities to include CNC machining and began serving aerospace and medical industries.

1990s.title: Technology Investment
1990s.description: Major investment in precision CNC equipment, establishing reputation for tight-tolerance machining.

2000s.title: Material Distribution
2000s.description: Launched comprehensive material distribution division, becoming a one-stop shop for customers.

2010s.title: Industry Leadership
2010s.description: Recognized as a leading plastic manufacturer serving 12+ industries with global reach.

today.title: Innovation Continues
today.description: Continuing to invest in advanced manufacturing technology while maintaining our commitment to quality.

values.title: Our Core Values
values.subtitle: The principles that guide everything we do.

qualityFirst.title: Quality First
qualityFirst.description: Zero-defect commitment from material selection through final inspection. Every part meets exact specifications.

onTimeDelivery.title: On-Time Delivery
onTimeDelivery.description: We understand that your production schedules depend on us. Reliable delivery is our promise.

quality.title: Quality & Certifications
quality.description: Quality isn't just a goal—it's built into every process. From incoming material inspection to final quality checks, we maintain rigorous standards that meet or exceed industry requirements.

cta.title: Let's Work Together
cta.subtitle: Partner with a company that's been delivering precision plastic manufacturing for over 55 years.

cncMachining.title: CNC Machining
cncMachining.subtitle: State-of-the-art CNC machining centers delivering precision plastic components with tolerances as tight as ±0.001" for the most demanding applications.
cncMachining.overviewParagraph1: Our CNC machining department combines advanced multi-axis equipment with decades of plastic machining expertise. Unlike metal machining, plastics require specialized knowledge of material behavior, cutting parameters, and thermal management to achieve optimal results.
cncMachining.overviewParagraph2: We machine everything from simple turned parts to complex 5-axis components, maintaining tight tolerances while ensuring excellent surface finishes. Our team works with you from design through production to optimize your parts for manufacturability.
features: Large format machining up to 48" x 96"

aerospace.name: Aerospace
aerospace.parts: Structural insulators, bearing housings, wear components

cncMachining.haveProjectDesc: Send us your drawings for a detailed quote within 24 hours.

fabrication.title: Custom Fabrication
fabrication.subtitle: Full-service plastic fabrication including cutting, routing, bending, bonding, and assembly for custom components and assemblies.
fabrication.overviewParagraph1: Our fabrication department handles everything from simple cut-to-size sheets to complex multi-component assemblies. We combine traditional fabrication techniques with modern CNC equipment to deliver consistent, high-quality results.
fabrication.overviewParagraph2: Whether you need a single prototype or production quantities, our experienced fabricators work with a wide range of plastic materials to meet your specifications.
fabrication.haveProjectDesc: Send us your drawings for a detailed quote within 24 hours.

secondaryOperations.title: Secondary Operations
secondaryOperations.subtitle: Complete finishing services including threading, heat treating, surface finishing, marking, and assembly to deliver ready-to-use parts.
secondaryOperations.overviewParagraph1: Our secondary operations department ensures your parts are delivered ready for use. From simple deburring to complex assembly, we handle all the finishing touches that turn machined components into finished products.
secondaryOperations.overviewParagraph2: By handling secondary operations in-house, we maintain quality control throughout the entire process and reduce lead times compared to outsourcing these services.

threading.name: Threading & Tapping
threading.description: Internal and external threads, helicoil inserts, threaded inserts

heatTreatment.description: Annealing to relieve stress and improve dimensional stability
